answers.answer: Hello,These symptoms can be due to metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism and hypoparathyroidism. They can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. Since the MRI spine and brain have come out normal, we need to do a NCV ( nerve conduction velocity) for ruling out any peripheral neuropathy as well.Please discuss these possibilities with your neurologist and get these investigations done. Keep on taking the prescribed medicines as suggested by your doctor.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: hi sir im 29 year female i m in nursing profession workin in cardiac unit i have pain in my left leg and numbness its start from my foot and goes to upword even though if i m walking setting my numbness will continue and when there is no numbness then i feel pain it start from foot  go towords the leg and i m getting tired very soon  e.g if i walk for one hour i feel very tired  i wnt to nurology he sugesst for me MRI BRAIN and MRI LUMBER SUPINE its all normal and now he suggest for me tab nurobian and tab endep once daily but sir i have still same problem i feel tired to going to the doctor they may think i m just jocking pleas help me sir what i can do more thanks
title: pain and numbness
